caption.title: Details of juxtacellular labeling.
caption.p: Number of juxtacellular labeling attempts on the final recording day for each animal (neurobiotin is metabolized within 24 hr). Letters refer to individually recorded neurons. E.g. in animal TV58, recorded neurons ‘e’ and ‘g’ were selected for juxtacellular labeling; in animal TV50 only neuron ‘a’ was recorded and labeled. A ‘labeling attempt’ refers to the application of current pulses to a recorded neuron. Modulation refers to successful entrainment of action potentials to the duration of positive current pulses (Pinault, 1996). Strength and duration of modulation are also estimated in order to predict the labeling strength (Table 1).
